django.db.backends.base.schema

Attributes

logger

Classes

BaseDatabaseSchemaEditor

This class and its subclasses are responsible for emitting schema-changing

Module Contents

django.db.backends.base.schema.logger[source]
class django.db.backends.base.schema.BaseDatabaseSchemaEditor(connection, collect_sql=False, atomic=True)[source]

This class and its subclasses are responsible for emitting schema-changing statements to the databases - model creation/removal/alteration, field renaming, index fiddling, and so on.

sql_create_table = 'CREATE TABLE %(table)s (%(definition)s)'[source]
sql_rename_table = 'ALTER TABLE %(old_table)s RENAME TO %(new_table)s'[source]

sql_delete_table = 'DROP TABLE %(table)s CASCADE'[source]
sql_create_column = 'ALTER TABLE %(table)s ADD COLUMN %(column)s %(definition)s'[source]
sql_alter_column = 'ALTER TABLE %(table)s %(changes)s'[source]
sql_alter_column_type = 'ALTER COLUMN %(column)s TYPE %(type)s%(collation)s'[source]
sql_alter_column_null = 'ALTER COLUMN %(column)s DROP NOT NULL'[source]
sql_alter_column_not_null = 'ALTER COLUMN %(column)s SET NOT NULL'[source]
sql_alter_column_default = 'ALTER COLUMN %(column)s SET DEFAULT %(default)s'[source]
sql_alter_column_no_default = 'ALTER COLUMN %(column)s DROP DEFAULT'[source]
sql_alter_column_no_default_null = 'ALTER COLUMN %(column)s DROP DEFAULT'[source]

sql_rename_column = 'ALTER TABLE %(table)s RENAME COLUMN %(old_column)s TO %(new_column)s'[source]
sql_update_with_default = 'UPDATE %(table)s SET %(column)s = %(default)s WHERE %(column)s IS NULL'[source]
sql_unique_constraint = 'UNIQUE (%(columns)s)%(deferrable)s'[source]
sql_check_constraint = 'CHECK (%(check)s)'[source]

sql_delete_check = 'ALTER TABLE %(table)s DROP CONSTRAINT %(name)s'[source]

sql_delete_unique = 'ALTER TABLE %(table)s DROP CONSTRAINT %(name)s'[source]

sql_create_inline_fk = None[source]
sql_create_column_inline_fk = None[source]

sql_create_index = 'CREATE INDEX %(name)s ON %(table)s (%(columns)s)%(include)s%(extra)s%(condition)s'[source]

connection[source]
collect_sql = False[source]
atomic_migration[source]
execute(sql, params=())[source]

Execute the given SQL statement, with optional parameters.

quote_name(name)[source]
table_sql(model)[source]

Take a model and return its table definition.

column_sql(model, field, include_default=False)[source]

Return the column definition for a field. The field must already have had set_attributes_from_name() called.

skip_default(field)[source]

Some backends don’t accept default values for certain columns types (i.e. MySQL longtext and longblob).

skip_default_on_alter(field)[source]

Some backends don’t accept default values for certain columns types (i.e. MySQL longtext and longblob) in the ALTER COLUMN statement.

abstractmethod prepare_default(value)[source]

Only used for backends which have requires_literal_defaults feature

effective_default(field)[source]

Return a field’s effective database default value.

abstractmethod quote_value(value)[source]

Return a quoted version of the value so it’s safe to use in an SQL string. This is not safe against injection from user code; it is intended only for use in making SQL scripts or preparing default values for particularly tricky backends (defaults are not user-defined, though, so this is safe).

create_model(model)[source]

Create a table and any accompanying indexes or unique constraints for the given model.

delete_model(model)[source]

Delete a model from the database.

add_index(model, index)[source]

Add an index on a model.

remove_index(model, index)[source]

Remove an index from a model.

rename_index(model, old_index, new_index)[source]
add_constraint(model, constraint)[source]

Add a constraint to a model.

remove_constraint(model, constraint)[source]

Remove a constraint from a model.

alter_unique_together(model, old_unique_together, new_unique_together)[source]

Deal with a model changing its unique_together. The input unique_togethers must be doubly-nested, not the single-nested [“foo”, “bar”] format.

alter_index_together(model, old_index_together, new_index_together)[source]

Deal with a model changing its index_together. The input index_togethers must be doubly-nested, not the single-nested [“foo”, “bar”] format.

alter_db_table(model, old_db_table, new_db_table)[source]

Rename the table a model points to.

alter_db_table_comment(model, old_db_table_comment, new_db_table_comment)[source]
alter_db_tablespace(model, old_db_tablespace, new_db_tablespace)[source]

Move a model’s table between tablespaces.

add_field(model, field)[source]

Create a field on a model. Usually involves adding a column, but may involve adding a table instead (for M2M fields).

remove_field(model, field)[source]

Remove a field from a model. Usually involves deleting a column, but for M2Ms may involve deleting a table.

alter_field(model, old_field, new_field, strict=False)[source]

Allow a field’s type, uniqueness, nullability, default, column, constraints, etc. to be modified. old_field is required to compute the necessary changes. If strict is True, raise errors if the old column does not match old_field precisely.

remove_procedure(procedure_name, param_types=())[source]
